title: Why is gas so much cheaper in Jacksonville North Carolina been in Wilmington? Also I have a picture of the Go gas sign in Jacksonville from today at $1.89 I can email to you if you'd like to use it.
text:
We already have some posts on our site that may answer your question. 



This link is about how gas retailers will price their gas based on the market and competition: 



http://www.myreporter.com/2009/08/why-are-gas-prices-different-in-different-parts-of-the-area-is-it-price-gouging/



This one is very specific to certain roads in Wilmington, but offers general insight into why gas prices fluctuate by location:



http://www.myreporter.com/2016/03/why-are-gas-prices-different-north-and-south-of-oleander-drive/



Hope that answers your question.
